definition: to advance prematurely
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
surname Mao
old variant of 冒[mao4]
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: They queered their Three-Year Plan by their premature advance.
sentences.chinese: 他们的盲目冒进使三年计划搞得一团糟。

sentences.english: But there are big risks, too, in aggressively pushing change.
sentences.chinese: 当然如果冒进推动这种变革，同时存在很大风险。

sentences.english: People would be wise to abandon rash inclinations and instead try in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 人们摒弃急燥冒进并代之以严肃认识是明智之举。

definition: to underestimate the enemy
cavalier/offhand/reckless
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
rude and impetuous
to go steady and strike hard (in fighting)/fig. steadily and surely
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
rash/impudent
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
hot-headed/impulsive/reckless
to zealously continue fighting
rashly/hastily/without careful consideration
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
